on the top of Finland's "arm" and it's the only real alpine village in Finland. Many important sights are located in Kilpisjärvi or nearby. Kilpisjärvi is served by regular busses from
and by line taxi from Hetta. There are several accommodation services
in the village including camping area, cottages and a hotel.

There are long distance snowmobile routes leading to Kilpisjärvi, especially the Victorialeden by the Finnish-Swedish border and the route through

. The latter requires a permit and is closed in the end of the season.

value: : the 200 km long route along the Finnish-Swedish border between Kilpisjärvi and Muonio is sometimes called
The tripoint in June, with high mountains in the background.

is with its 1328m the highest mountain of Finland. It's a popular destination among hikers and it's only possible to reach by foot. It's situated some 50 km north from the nearest village Kilpisjärvi.
is, like Halti also a popular destination among hikers. Saana has got an unmistakeable profile and it's situated just a few kilometres from Kilpisjärvi.
in Norwegian) is a place where the national borders of Finland, Sweden and Norway collide. It is located in Golddaluokta, about 20 kilometers from Kilpisjärvi. Place is reachable by boat or hiking.
Popular winter activities include cross country skiing, snow shoe hiking, snowmobiling or ice fishing.
content= Original Lapland style restaurant serving local dishes. I recommend trying, if you want to enjoy a true experience in Lappish cuisine.
content=The best restaurant in town. Scenic restaurant with views to the Saana and the lake. The best chef in town.
content=Nice 2-6 persons apartments and a restaurant.

Tundrea Holiday Resort is a holiday residence located in the very heart of Kilpisjärvi. You can stay either in hotel rooms or big chalets. Open all year round.
